unnormalised: ## Finding My Shanti: A Journey Through Yoga Practices
normalised: ## Finding My Shanti: A Journey Through Yoga Practices

unnormalised: Ever since I moved back to Mumbai after years in the US, the constant hustle was getting to me. My anxiety was through the roof, and I knew I needed to find a way to reconnect with myself. My grandmother, Amma, always told me stories of how yoga helped her through tough times, so I decided to give it a try.
normalised: Ever since I moved back to Mumbai after years in the U S, the constant hustle was getting to me. My anxiety was through the roof, and I knew I needed to find a way to reconnect with myself. My grandmother, Amma, always told me stories of how yoga helped her through tough times, so I decided to give it a try.

unnormalised: My first class was at a small studio in Bandra, called "Shanti Om Yoga". The instructor, a kind woman named Priya, guided us through basic asanas like Trikonasana and Adho Mukha Svanasana. I felt so clumsy! But even with my awkwardness, I felt a tiny bit of calm seeping in.
normalised: My first class was at a small studio in Bandra, called "Shanti Om Yoga". The instructor, a kind woman named Priya, guided us through basic asanas like Trikonasana and Adho Mukha Svanasana. I felt so clumsy! But even with my awkwardness, I felt a tiny bit of calm seeping in.

unnormalised: I started going regularly, 3 times a week. I explored different styles – Hatha, Vinyasa, and even a restorative session. My favourite is definitely Vinyasa; the flow is so dynamic, and I feel amazing afterwards. I also tried a weekend retreat at an ashram near Rishikesh. Waking up before dawn for pranayama and meditation overlooking the Ganges was a truly spiritual experience. We practiced yoga for hours each day in a hall that must have been 2000 sq ft!

unnormalised: It hasn't been a miracle cure, of course. Some days, my mind still races. But I've learned to use the breathing techniques Priya taught us, especially Kapalabhati, to calm my nerves. I also follow Dr. Sharma's advice on mindful eating, which complements my yoga practice perfectly. Now, even on stressful days dealing with clients and deadlines (Rs. 50,000 invoices piling up!), I find myself taking a few deep breaths and remembering the stillness I found in that little studio.

unnormalised: Yoga is more than just exercise; it's a way of life. It's about connecting with your inner self, finding balance, and appreciating the present moment. And for me, that's been invaluable. Amma was right all along. My next goal is to finally master the Sirsasana (headstand)! Maybe I'll even be able to run a marathon like my friend Rohan who runs 5 km daily. Wish me luck!
